author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: The Iranian ambassador to the United Nations, Amir-Saeid Iravani, said his country will “never stop” nuclear enrichment, saying it’s an “inalienable right” that Iran plans on exercising. In an interview on CBS News’s “Face the Nation,” moderator Margaret Brennan pressed the ambassador on whether Iran intends to “reconstitute a nuclear enrichment program on its soil.”...
title: Iran's UN ambassador: Iran's nuclear enrichment will 'never stop'

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) praised the Supreme Court ruling on Friday that limits judges’ ability to block the president’s policies nationwide. In an interview on ABC News’s “This Week,” Graham acknowledged that both sides have tried to select judges that would be most sympathetic to their lawsuit challenging an administration’s action — but Graham said...
title: Graham praises SCOTUS ruling limiting judges' ability to block presidential policies

author: Al Weaver
description: President Trump on Sunday celebrated Sen. Thom Tillis's (R-N.C.) announcement that he wouldn't seek reelection next year.  “Great News!” Trump wrote on Truth Social on Sunday evening.  The North Carolina senator abruptly announced his plans earlier in the day amid a days-long spat with the president over Tillis’s opposition to the GOP’s massive tax and spending bill. He...
title: Trump celebrates Tillis's decision to retire

author: Sylvan Lane
description: President Trump urged Senate Republicans on Sunday to overrule the chamber's parliamentarian in order to pass key parts of his sweeping domestic policy bill. In a Sunday post on Truth Social, the president backed a call from Rep. Greg Steube (R-Ohio) and other GOP hardliners to ignore rulings from Senate Parliamentarian Elizabeth MacDonough. "Great Congressman...
title: Trump urges Senate GOP to overrule parliamentarian

author: Caroline Vakil
description: The U.S.’s military intervention in Iran could roil next year’s House and Senate races in Michigan, a key battleground state that saw Democratic tensions play out last cycle over the war in Gaza. Democratic candidates in particular there will be forced to navigate a political minefield when it comes to President Trump’s involvement in Iran,...
title: Trump's Iran strikes threaten to roil elections in Michigan

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Democrats on Sunday accused Republicans of “going nuclear” to blow up the Senate rules so they can make President Trump’s 2017 tax cuts permanent. The heated moment on the Senate floor came as Democrats made several parliamentary inquiries of the Senate’s presiding chair to lay the groundwork to challenge Budget Committee Chair Lindsey Graham’s...
title: Democrats accuse GOP of nuking Senate rules to pass Trump megabill

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) said in a Sunday interview that he still has “a lot of questions” after the classified briefing on Friday about the Trump administration’s strikes on Iran last weekend. In an interview on ABC News’s “This Week,” Jeffries said he has not seen evidence suggesting the strikes “totally obliterated” the...
title: Jeffries still has 'a lot of questions' about Trump's Iran action

author: Tara Suter
description: Sen. Roger Marshall (R-Kan.) said Sunday that he believes President Trump’s “big, beautiful bill” is going to “help shrink the debt.” “I actually think this bill will help shrink the debt. I think it's going to grow the economy so much, just like it did under President Kennedy, President Reagan, President Clinton and then again,...
title: Marshall says he believes Trump megabill ‘will help shrink the debt’

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Sen. Mark Warner (D-Va.) said Sunday that President Trump’s megabill will be a “political albatross” for Republicans back at home. In an interview on CBS News’s “Face the Nation,” moderator Margaret Brennan noted that the GOP tax and spending bill, which just cleared a key hurdle in the Senate on Saturday night, includes some policies...
title: Virginia Democrat: Trump bill will be 'political albatross' for Republicans

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: The Senate Republicans’ tax and spending bill, which is speeding through the chamber, would result in deeper health care cuts and more people without insurance than the version that passed the House, according to a report from the Congressional Budget Office (CBO).  The legislation would result in 11.8 million Americans losing insurance by 2034, CBO found:...
title: GOP tax bill would mean 11.8 million people uninsured, $1.1 trillion in health cuts

author: Omar Mbowe, opinion contributor
description: Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac need to be restructured, but true modernization of housing finance requires addressing zoning laws, credit innovation and equity through transparency to ensure a system that works for everyone.
title: Reforming Fannie and Freddie is just the first step

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Michael McCaul (R-Texas) said in a Sunday interview that House Republicans know they won’t be reelected if they vote against final passage of President Trump’s megabill. In an interview on CBS News’s “Face the Nation,” McCaul outlined three reasons he supports the bill: border security, funding for the Department of Defense “at a time...
title: McCaul: GOP reps 'know the peril they're in if they vote no' on Trump megabill

author: Patrice Onwuka, opinion contributor
description: Congress may soon deliver a little bundle of joy to expecting parents and parents-to-be.
title: Trump Accounts are the savings solution America’s parents need

author: Al Weaver
description: Sen. Thom Tillis (R-N.C.) on Sunday announced he will not seek reelection to the Senate next year, firing a political shockwave into the midterm cycle after he said he would oppose President Trump’s mammoth tax package.  “As many of my colleagues have noticed over the last year, and at times even joked about, I haven't...
title: Tillis won't run for reelection in North Carolina

author: Shlomo Engelson Argamon, opinion contributor
description: These AI systems are already endangering public health — offering false assurances, bad advice and fake credentials — while hiding behind regulatory loopholes.
title: Dangerous AI therapy-bots are running amok. Congress must act.

description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) and Vice President Vance struck a deal Saturday night with Senate conservatives who want greater Medicaid spending cuts to save President Trump’s “big, beautiful bill” from stalling. The deal hatched in Thune’s office paved the way for Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) to flip his “no” vote on proceeding with the bill to “aye”...

author: Rachel Scully
description: President Trump went after Sen. Thom Tillis (R-N.C.) again on Sunday, saying he "hurt the great people of North Carolina" and calling him a "talker and complainer." "Thom Tillis has hurt the great people of North Carolina," Trump wrote on Truth Social Sunday morning. "Even on the catastrophic flooding, nothing was done to help until I took...
title: Trump slams Tillis again, calling him a 'talker and complainer, not a doer'

author: Tara Suter
description: New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani said Sunday he doesn’t believe “that we should have billionaires.” “You are a self-described democratic socialist. Do you think that billionaires have a right to exist?” NBC News’s Kristen Welker asked on “Meet the Press.” “I don't think that we should have billionaires because, frankly, it is so...
title: Mamdani says he doesn’t believe ‘that we should have billionaires’

description: We are teaching a generation to code; we should also teach them to decode news and information.
title: America needs a civic education moonshot, before it’s too late

description: Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has opened a new chapter of federal vaccine policy that invites questions on issues long considered to be settled and that pushes anti-vaccine priorities into mainstream government guidelines.  During his Senate confirmation hearings, Kennedy said he wouldn’t undermine vaccines.   “I am not going to...
title: RFK Jr. opens new chapter in US vaccine policy

author: Addy Bink
description: Radon is all around us, but exposure to high levels can prove detrimental. Here's what you should know.
title: Radon: The odorless, cancer-causing gas that may be in your home

author: Alexander Bolton
description: The Congressional Budget Office (CBO) projects that the tax piece of President Trump’s “big, beautiful bill,” a core component of his agenda, would add to deficits after 2034, the end of the 10-year budget window, and could therefore violate the Senate’s Byrd Rule.   Responding in a letter to Sen. Jeff Merkley (D-Ore.), the ranking...
title: CBO says tax piece of GOP megabill could violate Senate Byrd Rule

author: Rachel Scully
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) clarified that President Trump's "big, beautiful bill" does not cut Medicaid, but rather it reduces its growth. During a Sunday interview on ABC's "This Week," Graham was asked about Sen. Thom Tillis's (N.C.) warning that significant changes to Medicaid would be"devastating to North Carolina." Tillis voted against the bill. Graham said that while he respects Tillis, he...
title: Graham says Trump megabill reduces Medicaid growth: 'We haven't cut Medicaid'

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump said that the future New York City mayor must behave to get support from the federal government in his response to Zohran Mamdani's win in the Democratic mayoral primary. Trump was asked on Fox News "Sunday Morning Futures" with Maria Bartiromo about Mamdani and some of his policies, including fighting back against mass deportation efforts....
title: Trump after Mamdani win says next NYC mayor 'must behave' to get federal funds

author: Tara Suter
description: Sen. Chris Murphy (D-Conn.) said Sunday he believed “there’s a chance” President Trump’s “big, beautiful bill” will not achieve Senate passage. “Senator Murphy, do you think there's any chance that the so-called ‘big, beautiful bill’ does not pass the Senate?” NBC News’s Kristen Welker asked Murphy on “Meet the Press.” “I do think there's a...
title: Murphy says he thinks 'there's a chance' Trump's megabill doesn't pass

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump said that letters to trading partners will be going out soon to establish tariff rates, ahead of the July 8 expiration on the pause on his hefty "reciprocal" tariffs. "Basically, and I'm for doing it right now, we send letters out to all of the countries explaining to them— we'll look at the...
title: Trump said letters to trading partners going out ‘soon’ to set tariff rate

author: James F. Blumstein, opinion contributor
description: Tennessee's TennCare program has been a model for containing Medicaid costs through the use of a universal and mandatory managed care program, and the state's definition of "medical necessity" has become a national standard for considering economic factors in medical decision-making.
title: Congress should look to Tennessee as an example for Medicaid reform

author: Tara Suter
description: Sen. NBC News’s Kristen Welker asked on “Meet the Press.” “We’re very confident,” Mullin replied. “Listen, Kristen, the hardest part was getting on the bill. ...
title: Mullin says he is ‘very confident’ in Senate passage of Trump megabill

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump said that there will be a temporary pass issued for migrants working at farms and in the hospitality industry to allow employers to have more control after the administration has sent mixed messages about exceptions in the mass deportation efforts. Trump was asked on Fox News "Sunday Morning Futures" with Maria Bartiromo about his...
title: Trump says there will be ‘temporary pass’ for migrant farm, hotel workers
